intro: Lepidosperma pauperum, commonly known as the slender spike rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. This species typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments, often forming dense stands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spike-like clusters. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
